payload.description: Web interface for deployments, with plugin architecture and kubernetes support

pull_request.title: Revert "Revert "bump ruby patch version, oauth2, and faraday""
pull_request.body:
Reverts zendesk/samson#4073

This PR is a revert of a revert. When we deployed v3386, we experienced an issue resolving secrets that appeared, so we merged a revert of the previous PR which contained a handful of security bumps. We were unable to identify how any of those bumps could have caused the issue, and when we tested it again, we found the issue was resolved. We now believe it was caused by a transitory connection issue with one or more of our secret backends that happened to coincide with our deploy. This PR reapplies those security bumps and is equivalent to v3386.

repo.name: samson
repo.description: Web interface for deployments, with plugin architecture and kubernetes support

issue.title: Update Ruby and Rails
issue.body:
**Note**: Samson is a public repo, do not include Zendesk-internal information, urls, etc.

* Add description
* Add screenshots when changing the UI
* Add unit tests

### References
- Jira link: 

### Risks
- Low/Med/High: thing that could happen

comment.body: We reverted the PR for v3386 because we noticed a secret resolution issue after deploying. But we were unable to identify how any of the security bumps in that PR could have caused it. We planned to apply the bumps iteratively (hence this PR) but we tested v3386 again and did not see the same secret resolution issue. We now believe it was a transitory connection issue with one or more of our secret backends that happened to coincide with the previous release, negating the need for this PR.

pull_request.title: Revert "bump ruby patch version, oauth2, and faraday"
pull_request.body:
**Note**: Samson is a public repo, do not include Zendesk-internal information, urls, etc.

v3386 was causing some secrets to fail to resolve. It's unclear which version bump might have caused it, so we're going to apply the bumps incrementally to identify which one is problematic.

### References
- Jira link: 

### Risks
- Low/Med/High: Low, this is a revert PR that should result in a version identical to v3385
